div.l: With white shetes and white chalons faire spredde
Nought ferre from his owne bedde ten fote or twelue
His doughter hadde a bedde by hir selue
Right in the same chamber by and by
It myght be no bette and cause why
There nas no rom̉er herburgh in the place
They souped and spoken of solace
And dronken eủer stronge ale at the beste
A boute mydnyght wente they to reste
Wele hath this myln̉er vernysshed his hede
Full pale he was for dronke and nought rede
He yexet and he spake throwe the nose
As he were in the quak or on the pose
To bedde he gothe and wᵗith hym goth his wyf
As any Iay she was light and Iolyf
So was hir Iolye whistill wele y wette
The cradill at the beddes fete she sette
To rokke and to yeue the childe Souke
And when that dronken all was in the crouke
To bedde wente the doughter right anoone
To bedde gothe Aleyn and also Iohn
There nas no more hem nedeth no dwale
This myln̉er hath so wisely bibed ale
That as an hors he snoreth in his slepe
Ne of his tayle be hynde toke he no kepe
His wyf bare hym Fa burdon full stronge
Men myght here hir route a furlonge
The wenche also routed eke ꝑpar company
Aleyn the clerke that herde this melody
He plucked Iohn and seide slepes thou
Herdyst thou eủer slyke a songe or nowe
Loo slyk a couplyng is betwene hem all
A wylde fyre vppon thaire bodies falle
Who herkenyd eủer swylke a ferly thing
Yaa they shull haue the floure of Euyll Endyng
This longe nyght there tides me no reste
But yete no fors all shall be for the beste
For Iohn seide all so eủer mote I thryve
If I may yender wenche shall I swyve
Some esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn there is lawe seith thus
That if a man in a poynte be agreued
That in a nother he shall be releued
